results.title: Extreme prejudice
results.creator_credit: Carolco Pictures, Tri-Star Pictures, Buzz Feitshans and Walter Hill
results.brief_description: Director Walter Hill helms this macho neo-Western with aplomb, providing a plethora of violence and mayhem, in the style of Sam Peckinpah (Hill worked as a screenwriter on several Peckinpah films). Nick Nolte plays Jack Benteen, a Texas Ranger with an incendiary attitude (that apes Dirty Harry), driven by the lawlessness and brutality that has invaded his hometown since the drug trade has escalated there. Heading a key operation is former friend, Cash Bailey; Cash and Benteen are in love with the same sexy Mexican woman, currently Benteen’s girlfriend, which incenses their conflict. Benteen’s success in disarming his former friend is limited and he is countered by a crack team of mercenaries, all ex-army and officially dead or missing, who have been engaged to eliminate Cash and his merciless crew. The bloodshed in this film is quite relentless, lots of bullet-riddled bodies and big guns, interspersed with numerous high tech crimes. Hill tries to keep the central conflict interesting but the variety of sub-plots and the many scenes of testosterone fuelled vicious encounters, muddies the narrative focus.

results.title: Extreme art 2
results.brief_description: Further explorations in experimental music video from Western Europe. As in the first collection of “Extreme Art”, these industrial-electronic musicians use sound and images heavily influenced by European surrealism. In this volume many of the contributions show the influence of the acid- house music scene, with a greater use of sampling in the music and a greater reliance on computer animation in the video imagery. The collection spans across punk, industrial music, heavy metal and house to deliver music at the edge of chaos.

results.title: Extreme art
results.brief_description: This is a collection of Western European experimental music videos. Featuring collaborations between electronic composers and avant-garde image-makers, the artists in “Extreme Art” all share a commitment to an artistic expression the roots of which are to be found in surrealism and dada. The visual work combines computer animation, video collage, and super-8 film to present a menacing vision of technological society at the point of implosion. The music in this video ranges from minimalist electronic experimentation to bizarre combinations of indigenous ethnic music with computer simulated noise; to brooding, menacing industrial soundscapes. Though the artists represented in this music video sampler are all unique from one another, they are all uncompromising in their desire to produce work which unsettles and disturbs. NOTE: SOME OF THE VIDEO IMAGERY MIGHT BE DISTURBING. DO NOT ADJUST YOUR SET - SOME VIDEO SEGMENTS ARE DELIBERATELY UNSTABLE.

results.title: Extraordinary American films produced between 1899-1908
results.brief_description:
Compilation of silent motion pictures restored from the Library of Congress paper prints.
Contents: Love and war (prod: James H. White, 1899)—The Girl from Montana (prod: William N. Selig, 1907)—His first ride (prod: William N. Selig, 1907)—The Bandit ring (prod: William N. Selig, 1907)—The Bank robbery (prod: Oklahoma Natural Mutoscene Company, 1908)

results.title: Extinction is forever!
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Ministry of Education and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: Kerry Aulsbrook, an Education Officer specializing in natural history at the Museum of Victoria introduces Australian customs regulations prohibiting imports of animals and natural products. Examines the threats faced by species now close to extinction because of human interference.

results.title: Extinction is forever
results.creator_credit: Central Coast Media, Mark Falzon and Michael Edols
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “Under southern skies”.
This episode looks at various species that are endangered in Australia. Doctor Tony Oliver of the West Australian Department of Agriculture discusses the complex and fragile interdependence of Australia’s plant kingdom and animals.

results.title: External respiration
results.brief_description: Illustrates and discusses, by means of animated diagrams, the passage of air from the nose to lungs, the function of the nasal passages, trachea, thorax, diaphragm and lungs, transference of oxygen to the bloodstream and the expulsion of surplus carbon-dioxide during expiration.

results.title: External parasites of sheep: sheep body louse, the ked, the itch mite
results.brief_description: Deals with the body louse, the ked (commonly known as the tick) and the itch mite in sheep and recommends suitable dips for each.

results.title: Exterior wall with tyrolean finish
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Plastering”.
This first coat consists of a water repellent cement. Materials and their proportions are stated. The surface is scratched to provide a key for the next coat. This second coat is applied with the help of dots and screeds to ensure a true vertical surface. The formation of a plinth is demonstrated. This is made in two stages, core and finishing coat. The wall itself may be finished in various ways. Three different kinds of finishing coats are shows: Tyrolean finish, pebble dash, and rough cast.

results.title: Extensions of the family
results.brief_description: A self-selected “family of 13” buys a house in a large western city and shares responsibilities. Originally, four adults held the mortgage. Since the film was made, two of the original members have moved and new arrangements have been made to share equitably with other people who have joined the group. This is a continuing experiment with alternatives to the prevailing nuclear family.
